result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott E Karenz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse]. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.
  • Criminal Damage to Property <$300 [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse]. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at a rate of $25.00 per month commencing 12-01-2016 or 6 days jail. Payment plan fee will be added to the case.

Defendant Scott E Karenz in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Prosecuting attorney moves to amend Count 2 to Disorderly Conduct contrary to section 13.102(c)(8) of the Waukesha County Code of Ordinances and to amend Count 3 to Criminal Damage to Property contrary to section 13-102(c)(4) of the Waukesha County Code of Ordinances.  Court approves amendment.  No contest plea entered. Count 1 is dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the following:

Count 2:

FINE:  $267.50
DOMESTIC VIOLENCE SURCHARGE:  $100.00

Count 3:

FINE:  $299.00

To be paid at the rate of $25/month commencing 12/1/16 or 12 days jail for penalty for non payment of fine.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 31, 2016 at 08:30 am.
